Articles.Content: basically, in the steam options u can set the current beta of ksp to a previous version, like 1.0.5 or 1.1.3, or 1.2.9, but if there was a way to set it to 1.2.2, which is the exact same as the current version when u have it set too none, BUT when steam updates it wont automatically update ,so you get to keep all your mod files intact. sounds good, right?
I'm pretty sure when 1.3 finally drops, 1.2.2 will be in that list. Then, all you will have to do is choose it to continue your game.

Since 1.0, that seems to be what they have been doing.  You can now select 1.0(.5). and 1.1(.3) so I would imagine 1.2(.2) will also be on there.

1.2.9 is 1.3, that one doesn't count, it's just Squad and their strange numbering again.

Edited May 8, 2017 by Alshain
The idea is to have 1.2.2 in the beta tab before 1.3 is released in order to be safe from the auto update.

You can turn auto update off. Steam will still try to update when you launch the game through Steam, but either launch it manually or just hold off for the brief period between 1.3 releasing and 1.2.2 turning up in the beta tab.
Best practice with Steam and modded installs is to copy the stock install out of your Steam folder and mod that new copy. Steam updates will never affect it then.

On 5/9/2017 at 2:35 AM, Harry Rhodan said:

The idea is to have 1.2.2 in the beta tab before 1.3 is released in order to be safe from the auto update.

It wouldn't matter.  If they make the 1.2.2 distribution at the same time as the 1.3 release, you just select that after they do.  Worst case, it has to re-download a little but but this game isn't all that large to begin with.  It won't hurt anything if it updates, Steam is smart enough to revert it, and it won't touch files that are not part of it's own installation (i.e. mods and saves).
